name: generally

B2 considering the whole of someone or something, and not just a particular part of him, her, or it: Your health is generally good, but you do have a few minor problems. He wants more money to be given to the arts generally. I shall now develop my previous point more generally (= to say more about what it includes).
B1 usually, or in most situations: The baby generally wakes up three times during the night.generally speaking Well, generally speaking (= in most situations), it's quicker on public transport.
B2 by most people, or to most people: It was generally believed at the time that both men were guilty. The proposal has received a generally favourable reaction.
More examplesFewer examplesLack of experience will generally count against you in an interview.In my experience, people generally smile back if you smile at them.Vegetables are generally low in calories.You get the odd person who's rude to you but they're generally quite helpful.This disease doesn't generally respond to treatment.
